qas.question: Who said the imperial honors were against Christian teachings?
With what veneration did most Christians have little trouble?
To what did the Christian church equate the peace of the emperors?
What pontifax maximus favored the Catholic church?
What Christian group did Constantine I disapprove?

context: With the abatement of persecution, <a0_0>St. Jerome<a0_0/> acknowledged the Empire as a bulwark against evil but insisted that "imperial honours" were contrary to Christian teaching. His was an authoritative but minority voice: most Christians showed no qualms in the veneration of even <a1_0>"pagan" emperors<a1_0/>. The peace of the emperors was the <a2_0>peace of God<a2_0/>; as far as the Church was concerned, internal dissent and doctrinal schism were a far greater problem. The solution came from a hitherto unlikely source: as pontifex maximus <a3_0>Constantine I<a3_0/> favoured the "Catholic Church of the Christians" against the <a4_0>Donatists<a4_0/> because:
